metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19448 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21 and 5.3.11, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image, performing some operations, and then making a syncfs system call can lead to a use-after-free in try_merge_free_space in fs/btrfs/free-space-cache.c because the pointer to a left data structure can be the same as the pointer to a right data structure. It was discovered that the btrfs file system in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability when merging free space. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious btrfs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-19448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-37-generic - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-5.13.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-37-generic - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-37-generic-64k - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-37-lowlatency - 5.11.0-16.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1019-aws - 5.11.0-1006.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Exploiting this vulnerability requires a crafted filesystem image to be mounted sbeattie> it's asserted that the btrfs enhanced tree-checker should address this issue; this was backported to at least the 4.15 kernels.
